ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I have been unhappy because of my drinking or drug use
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Once or a few times; 2 = Once or twice a week; 3 = Daily or almost daily

ElementDescription: Because of my drinking or drug use, I have lost weight or not eaten properly

Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Once or a few times; 2 = Once or twice a week; 3 = Daily or almost daily

ElementDescription: Physical Score
Notes: Sum of responses to items 2, 10, and 12

ElementDescription: Interpersonal Score
Notes: Sum of responses to items 13, 14, and 16

ElementDescription: Intrapersonal Score
Notes: Sum of responses to items 1, 4, and 15

ElementDescription: Impulse Control Score
Notes: Sum of responses to items 5, 6, and 7

ElementDescription: Social Responsibility Score
Notes: Sum of responses to items 3, 8, 9, 11, and 17

ElementDescription: Total SIP-R Score
Notes: Sum of physical score, interpersonal score, intrapersonal score, impulse control score, and social responsibility score
